alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 28 at 5:14PM MST until September 28 at 9:15PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR MARICOPA AND PINAL COUNTIES... At 514 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area earlier this afternoon. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen, which may be resulting in areas of running water across low-water crossings as well as areas of standing water. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Mesa, Chandler, Gilbert, Sun Lakes, Queen Creek, Chandler Heights, Seville, San Tan Mountain Park, Phoenix Mesa Gateway Airport, San Tan Village Mall, San Tan Valley, Tumbleweed Park, Higley and Santan. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 87 between mile markers 150 and 159. AZ Route 202 between mile markers 40 and 47. This includes the following streams and drainages... Queen Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
